description:
exp/gui: delete exp/gui and exp/gui/x11. They are moving to
x-go-binding.googlecode.com.

messages.text:
apologies, ignore this, i hadn't seen the other CL.

On 17 November 2011 12:49, roger peppe <rogpeppe@gmail.com> wrote:
> would it be possible to move these to x-go-binding.googlecode.com
> *before* deleting them?
>

would it be possible to move these to x-go-binding.googlecode.com
*before* deleting them?

Hello rsc@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=1fcb3b9a776a ***

exp/gui: delete exp/gui and exp/gui/x11. They are moving to
x-go-binding.googlecode.com.

R=rsc, rogpeppe
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5406041
Any special reason why exp/gui has to go, too? Is anything in the standard lib going to replace it?

On 22 November 2011 07:38,  <jasmuth@gmail.com> wrote:
> Any special reason why exp/gui has to go, too? Is anything in the
> standard lib going to replace it?

It moved because it was closer to the x11 back-end than anything else.

Package exp/gui was still at the very early toy stage. Nobody was
using it for a real app. There may eventually be some sort of standard
cross-platform GUI package, but I don't know anyone who is working on
one. Even if there was one, it would probably live outside of the
standard library (and could therefore depend on things like xgb if it
wanted to).

subject: code review 5406041: exp/gui: delete exp/gui and exp/gui/x11. They are moving to
